meanings.definition: To report less than the actual amount or extent.
meanings.sent1: She always underreports her expenses to save money.
meanings.sent2: The company underreports its profits to avoid taxes.
meanings.sent3: The detective underreports the number of clues he found to surprise his partner.
meanings.sent4: The artist underreports the colors in his painting to create a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The student underreports the time spent studying, leading to poor grades.

meanings.definition: Reports less than the actual amount or extent.
meanings.sent1: He underreports his income to pay less tax.
meanings.sent2: The journalist underreports the casualties of the accident.
meanings.sent3: The chef underreports the ingredients in the recipe for a fun cooking challenge.
meanings.sent4: The author underreports the emotions of the characters to build suspense.
meanings.sent5: The athlete underreports the distance covered during training, affecting performance.
